lead_paragraph: Jeremy Wariner set the best time in the world this year in the 400 meters at the Gaz de France meet in St.-Denis, finishing in 43.86 seconds and outclassing his main rival and fellow American LaShawn Merritt, who was second in 44.35.
snippet: Jeremy Wariner set the best time in the world this year in the 400 meters at the Gaz de France meet in St.-Denis, finishing in 43.86 seconds and outclassing his main rival and fellow American LaShawn Merritt, who was second in 44.35.
